programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Heavyweight title bout at Madison Square Garden in New York. From March 8, 1971.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From 1970 and 1973.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The high-flying No. 11 Beavers (6-1, 3-1 Pac-12) line up against the Wildcats (4-3, 2-2). Oregon State is sporting the 12th-best offense in the nation at 38.1 points scored per game. Oregon State took down Arizona 56-38 in their last meeting in 2019.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Monday Blitz
programme.desc: A fast-paced offering that blends the NFL and college football while focusing on the weekend that was and broader topics; includes moments and significant achievements from all levels of football, such as high school, youth and flag football.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: Monday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Previewing the Monday Night Football matchup airing later on ESPN. Host Scott Van Pelt is joined by Ryan Clark, Robert Griffin III, Marcus Spears, Adam Schefter and Michelle Beisner-Buck as they analyze every last morsel of information pertaining to Monday night's combatants, plus discuss the latest news that developed out of Sunday's action.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Lions (5-2) try to stay perfect in prime time as they host the Raiders (3-4). Detroit rookie running back Jahmyr Gibbs broke out in Week 7. The Alabama product racked up a career-high 126 yards from scrimmage and scored his first touchdown.

programme.title: Monday Night Postgame
programme.desc: A recap of the Monday Night Football matchup with highlights, interviews and more.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special
programme.desc: With the NFL trade deadline ending on October 31th at 4pm ET, a look at what trade rumors were real and how teams around the NFL are preparing for a championship run or building for the future.

programme.title: College Football Playoff: Top 25
programme.desc: College Football action, analysis, rankings and more.

programme.title: NHL Hockey
programme.desc: The Kings try to stay perfect on the road when they face off against the Maple Leafs. The series is tied 74-74-21. Toronto fell to 5-2-1 on the season following a 3-2 loss in overtime at Nashville on Oct. 28. Los Angeles is 3-0-0 away from home.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Zion Williamson's Pelicans face Chet Holmgren's Thunder. Williamson, who missed the final 46 games of New Orleans' 2022-23 campaign, provided 23 points in a road victory at Memphis on Oct. 25. Holmgren missed all of last season with a foot injury.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Features greatest moments from the UFC's vast library of fight footage.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: Sergio Perez seeks an F1 victory on home soil when the circuit stops in Mexico.

programme.title: Red Bull Imagination 2023
programme.desc: An all new freeride playground where the top riders compete in a single day competition to crown the winner.

programme.title: World of X Games
programme.desc: Previews, highlights and stories involving events and athletes from the X Games.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Gamecocks (2-5, 1-4 SEC) try to start a streak versus the Aggies (4-3, 2-2). South Carolina took down Texas A&M 30-24 in 2022 for its first win in nine tries in the head-to-head set. Texas A&M comes off one-score losses to Alabama and Tennessee.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 18 Cardinals (6-1, 3-1) try to recover from their loss by hosting No. 20 Duke (5-2, 2-1) for an ACC affair. Louisville was stunned in its last game, 38-21 at Pittsburgh on Oct. 14. Duke comes off a 38-20 setback at No. 4 Florida State.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: First Take

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Joey Galloway and Dan Mullen.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: Daily Wager
programme.desc: Doug Kezirian joins sports betting experts as well as ESPN analysts and reporters from various sports for discussion centered on analytics and point spreads as well as how the day's sports news affects betting.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: From Oct. 30, 1974, dubbed the "Rumble in the Jungle."

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: Muhammad Ali seeks to avenge his loss to Joe Frazier in their first fight. The result was a classic battle of wills in what is considered an all-time great heavyweight fight. From Jan. 28, 1974 at Madison Square Garden in New York.

programme.title: Boxing
programme.desc: The "Thrilla in Manila" is consistently ranked as one of the best bouts in boxing history and was the culmination of a three-bout rivalry between Muhammad Ali and Joe Frazier. From Sept. 30, 1975.

programme.title: UFC - The Walk
programme.desc: In 2018, UFC light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier took on the baddest man on the planet, heavyweight champ Stipe Miocic. Take an in-depth look at both competitors' journeys to the Octagon and relive Cormier's historic performance.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: John T. Edge travels around the region, introducing viewers to Southern tastemakers, food, culture and history as they intertwine in the beautiful yet complex South.

programme.title: Monday Blitz
programme.desc: A fast-paced offering that blends the NFL and college football while focusing on the weekend that was and broader topics; includes moments and significant achievements from all levels of football, such as high school, youth and flag football.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The players of the 2000 Baltimore Ravens come together to reflect on their legendary year of winning the Super Bowl.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The 1983 NFL Draft was highlighted by a record six quarterbacks being taken in the first round, including John Elway and Dan Marino.

programme.title: SportsCenter Special: My Wish
programme.desc: Athletes work with Make-A-Wish® to fulfill sports-themed wishes for children with critical illness.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.title: The Point
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship hockey show featuring highlights, news, analysis, speed, skill and access to the biggest stars, stories and personalities of the game. Hosted by John Buccigross.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Rockets (7-1, 4-0) host the Bulls (3-5, 3-1) in a potential Mid-American Conference title game preview. Toledo leads the West Division, while Buffalo is second in the East. Buffalo outscored Toledo 114-74 in winning the last three meetings.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight
programme.desc: If you're a fan of baseball, then you won't want to miss this show featuring highlights of all the games and updates of ones still in progress. Regularly hosted by Karl Ravech, he's joined by a rotating panel of analysts that includes former players and managers, plus reporters such as Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney. Other hosts include Adnan Virk and Jon Sciambi.

programme.title: DC & RC
programme.desc: Former UFC two-division champion Daniel Cormier and former Super Bowl champion Ryan Clark talk about their shared love of MMA and the rest of the sports world.

programme.title: UFC Ultimate Knockouts
programme.desc: The greatest finishers from the heavyweight division including Cain Velasquez, Minotauro Nogueira, Junior dos Santos, Andrei Arlovski and more.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Front row seats to two fights for the most prestigious title in combat sports: the UFC heavyweight championship. With Cain Velasquez and Fabricio Werdum.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Wednesday MACtion is back with Ball State (2-6, 1-3) and Bowling Green (4-4, 2-2) meeting for the first time in nearly eight years. The Falcons have won seven of the past eight get-togethers, including the last in 2015, and leads the series 21-9-1.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: No. 1 FC Cincinnati begin their playoff run in Game 1 of the first round against No. 8 RBNY. The Red Bulls waxed Charlotte FC 5-2 in the play-in game, with Elias Manoel collecting a hat trick. Cincinnati lost just twice at home in the regular season.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: St. Louis City SC host Sporting Kansas City for Game 1 of their first-round series. St. Louis topped the Western Conference in its inaugural season with a 17-12-5 record and 62 goals scored. SKC ousted San Jose on penalties in the wild-card round.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: No. 6 Oklahoma (7-0, 4-0 Big 12) seeks its 19th straight victory over Kansas (5-2, 2-2). The Jayhawks last defeated the Sooners in 1997. Oklahoma kept its national championship hopes alive with a 31-29 triumph over upset-minded UCF last week.

programme.title: The Joel Klatt Show: Big Noon Conversations
programme.desc: Joel Klatt sits down to discuss the 2023 season with some of NCAA football's most prominent coaches and commissioners.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A clash of Pac-12 heavyweights pits the No. 13 Utes (6-1, 3-1) against the No. 8 Ducks (6-1, 3-1). Oregon grinded out a 20-17 home victory against Utah last season, but hasn't prevailed in Salt Lake City since 2016. Utah is 4-0 at home this year.

programme.title: The Carton Show
programme.desc: Craig Carton, one of New York's best-known voices, analyzes and debates the biggest headlines in sports each morning.

programme.title: Undisputed
programme.desc: A daily sports talk show hosted by Skip Bayless, where each day Skip is joined by a cast of NFL legends for passionate conversations about the biggest sports topics of the day.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd
programme.desc: Colin Cowherd and co-host Jason McIntyre break down the biggest stories and interview the biggest guests in sports.

programme.title: First Things First
programme.desc: Nick Wright, Chris Broussard and Kevin Wildes explore and energetically advance the biggest stories in sports to start the day.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: Opinions and predictions for happenings in the NFL.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Hub
programme.desc: Highlights, news, opinion, and a heavy dose of unexpected fun from the always-rocking world of NASCAR.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: Orlando City SC host Nashville SC for Game 1 of their Eastern Conference first-round playoff series. The clubs split two matches in the regular season, their first meetings since Nashville knocked Orlando from the first round of the 2021 postseason.

programme.title: MLS Soccer
programme.desc: No. 2 Sounders FC host No. 7 FC Dallas for Game 1 of their best-of-three first-round playoff series. The sides twice tied 1-1 this season. Seattle returns to the playoffs after not qualifying in 2022, its first miss since joining MLS in 2009.

programme.title: MLB on FS1 Postgame
programme.desc: Highlights, analysis and a wrap-up of today's MLB action.

programme.title: MLB on FS1 Postgame
programme.desc: Highlights, analysis and a wrap-up of today's MLB action.

programme.title: 2023 World Series
programme.desc: Ketel Marte and the Diamondbacks host the Rangers for Game 3 of the World Series. Marte set an MLB record by recording a hit in his 18th straight postseason game, contributing a two-run single in Game 2 as Arizona tied the series with a 9-1 victory.

programme.title: 2023 World Series
programme.desc: Ketel Marte and the Diamondbacks host the Rangers for Game 3 of the World Series. Marte set an MLB record by recording a hit in his 18th straight postseason game, contributing a two-run single in Game 2 as Arizona tied the series with a 9-1 victory.

programme.desc: The Diamondbacks host the Rangers in Game 4 of the World Series. Arizona bench coach Jeff Banister served as Texas' manager from 2015-2018, compiling a 327-319 overall record, and guiding the Rangers to back-to-back AL West titles in 2015 and 2016.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Knights (3-4, 0-4 Big 12) and Mountaineers (4-3, 2-2) try to snap hard-luck streaks. UCF is still searching for its first conference win after suffering one- and two-point losses. West Virginia has dropped two straight despite totaling 73 points.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: A clash of Pac-12 heavyweights pits the No. 13 Utes (6-1, 3-1) against the No. 8 Ducks (6-1, 3-1). Oregon grinded out a 20-17 home victory against Utah last season, but hasn't prevailed in Salt Lake City since 2016. Utah is 4-0 at home this year.

programme.title: Fútbol MLS
programme.desc: Orlando City SC recibe a Nashville SC en el primer duelo de la primera ronda de los playoffs de la Conferencia Este. Los clubes dividieron dos partidos en la temporada regular. Nashville eliminó a Orlando de la primera ronda de la postemporada 2021.

programme.title: Fútbol MLS
programme.desc: El Sounders FC recibe al FC Dallas en el juego 1 de su serie de primera ronda de playoffs. Ambos equipos empataron 1-1 esta temporada. Seattle vuelve a los playoffs tras no clasificar en 2022, su primera ausencia desde que se unió a la MLS en 2009.

programme.title: 2022 CONCACAF Champions League: Seattle's Road to Glory
programme.desc: The Sounders become the first MLS club to win the CONCACAF Champions League with an incredible run to claim their first intercontinental title.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 5 Huskies seek their first 8-0 start in seven years when they line up against the Cardinal. Mishael Powell's 89-yard pick-six saved Washington's College Football Playoff hopes and secured a 15-7 triumph over Arizona State on Oct. 21.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cornhuskers try to keep rolling as they host the Boilermakers. Nebraska has won four of its last five after toppling Northwestern in Week 8. However, Purdue has claimed four of the last five meetings with Nebraska after prevailing 43-37 in 2022.

programme.desc: The Clippers get their first look at Victor Wembanyama as the Spurs visit. Wembanyama had 15 points and five rebounds Oct. 25 in his NBA debut, a loss to Dallas. Ivica Zubac posted 20 points and 12 boards in LA's 123-111 win over Portland that night.
